intro: Diplopanax, commonly known as the false ginseng, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araliaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to Asia, particularly China and Japan. The plants are typically shrubs or small trees, characterized by their opposite, simple leaves and small, white or greenish flowers. They are often found in forested areas and are valued for their ornamental qualities. Some species of Diplopanax are also used in traditional medicine.
